skill.name: research-lookup
skill.description: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro models through OpenRouter. Automatically selects the best model based on query complexity. Search academic papers, recent studies, technical documentation, and general research information with citations.
skill.summary: Look up current research information using Perplexity's Sonar Pro Search or Sonar Reasoning Pro mode...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Legitimate research lookup tool that makes API calls to OpenRouter for academic queries. Network access is essential for its purpose. Uses environment variable for API key - standard secure practice. No filesystem access, no command execution, no credential harvesting.

content.value_statement: Finding current research and academic papers takes significant time. This skill uses Perplexity Sonar models through OpenRouter to search academic literature, recent studies, and technical documentation with automatic citations.
actual_capabilities: Search academic papers and peer-reviewed journals via Perplexity Sonar models
Automatic citation extraction with DOI and source links
Intelligent model selection between Pro Search and Reasoning Pro
Batch query processing for literature reviews
limitations: Requires OPENROUTER_API_KEY and credits for API access
Cannot access paywalled full-text articles directly
May miss very recent papers not yet indexed in search
Dependent on Perplexity API availability and rate limits

use_cases.title: Literature reviews
use_cases.description: Gather current research for papers, theses, and grant proposals with proper citations.

use_cases.title: Fact verification
use_cases.description: Verify claims, statistics, and findings against current peer-reviewed sources.

use_cases.title: Paper discovery
use_cases.description: Find relevant studies and foundational works for literature review sections.

prompt_templates.title: Simple paper search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find recent papers on a topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recent academic papers on [TOPIC] from 2024. Include authors, titles, journals, and DOIs.

prompt_templates.title: Compare studies
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [METHOD A] versus [METHOD B] for [APPLICATION]. Include key studies with citations.

prompt_templates.title: Protocol lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the standard protocol for [PROCEDURE]? Include step-by-step and recent improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Systematic review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a systematic review on [RESEARCH QUESTION]. Find all relevant randomized controlled trials, meta-analyses, and systematic reviews from 2020-2024 with full citations.

output_examples.input: Recent advances in mRNA vaccine technology 2024
output: Summary of key findings from 5 recent papers
Complete citations with authors, titles, journals, and DOIs

best_practices: Use specific queries with timeframes (e.g., "2024") for better results
Break complex literature reviews into multiple focused queries
Always verify citations against original sources for accuracy
Combine with WebSearch to verify publication metadata like DOIs and years
anti_patterns: Asking overly broad queries like "tell me about AI"
Relying solely on AI-generated citations without verification
Expecting access to full-text articles behind paywalls
Ignoring the automatic model selection for simple vs complex queries

faq.question: What models does this skill use?
faq.answer: Perplexity Sonar Pro Search for fast lookups and Sonar Reasoning Pro for complex analysis. Automatic selection based on query keywords.

faq.question: How much do queries cost?
faq.answer: Typical costs range from $0.01 to $0.05 per query through OpenRouter. Monitor usage through your OpenRouter dashboard.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI tools?
faq.answer: Yes, works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The skill makes independent API calls to OpenRouter.

faq.question: Is my research data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to OpenRouter to access Perplexity models. No research data is stored or shared beyond completing your request.

faq.question: Why are some citations incomplete?
faq.answer: Citations depend on what Perplexity API returns. Some sources may lack full metadata. Use WebSearch to verify details.

faq.question: How is this different from WebSearch?
faq.answer: Research-lookup uses Perplexity Sonar models optimized for academic sources. WebSearch is a general web search better for current events and non-academic sources.
